info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 28 at 9:57AM EDT until August 28 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT TODAY FOR NORTHEASTERN KANAWHA, SOUTHERN ROANE AND WESTERN CLAY COUNTIES... At 957 AM EDT, Radar and gauge reports indicated between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen this morning. Although the heavy rain has since ended, runoff will continue to result in flash flooding. There are several reports of flooding in the Clendenin area. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Clendenin. This includes the following streams and drainages... Porter Creek, Leatherwood Creek, Hurricane Creek, Big Sandy Creek, Garner Branch, King Shoals Run, and Falling Rock Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
